page.title: 02 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Kenley is interesting for the fact that Archibald Alison was rector there. He wrote the book "Essay on the Nature and Principles of Tastle" and was a close friend of Thomas Telford, after whom the new town of Telford is named. These two men played bowls together in the Kenley area when they had time. The Rector's son was born at Kenley and he became a judge, writing works on law and a 10 volume history of Europe. Page six tells a little more about Kenley Church where Sir Archibald Alison was REctor. In the church is a tablet which is dedicated to the memory of this Rector. After leaving Kenley, Alison became minister of a church in Edinburgh.
